intro: Eugenia florida, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blossoms. Eugenia florida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
